lead_paragraph: Updated, 7:50 p.m. | Under intense pressure from Democratic Party officials, Harold E. Ford Jr., the former Tennessee congressman, has decided not to challenge Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand in the primary this fall.
snippet: Harold E. Ford Jr. told friends that he could beat Kirsten E. Gillibrand but feared the damage that his candidacy might inflict on the party, said the people he told of his plans....
abstract: Harold E. Ford Jr. told friends that he could beat Kirsten E. Gillibrand but feared the damage that his candidacy might inflict on the party, said the people he told of his plans.
